intro: Dactyladenia gilletii, commonly known as the African ghost orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. This plant is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often pale green or white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically growing on trees or rocks. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
